skill.name: when-releasing-new-product-orchestrate-product-launch
skill.description:
Use when launching a new product end-to-end from market research through post-launch monitoring.
Orchestrates 15+ specialist agents across 5 phases in a 10-week coordinated workflow including
research, development, marketing, sales preparation, launch execution, and ongoing optimization.
Employs hierarchical coordination with parallel execution for efficiency and comprehensive coverage.
skill.summary:
Use when launching a new product end-to-end from market research through post-launch monitoring.
Orc...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that describes workflow patterns for product launches. It contains no executable code, network calls, file system access, or security-sensitive operations. The skill provides orchestration patterns and coordination scripts for AI agents but does not execute any commands itself.

content.user_title: Orchestrate Complete Product Launches with AI Swarms
content.value_statement: Coordinating product launches across multiple teams is complex and error-prone. This skill orchestrates 15+ specialized AI agents through a proven 10-week workflow covering research, development, marketing, launch, and optimization phases.
actual_capabilities: Coordinates 15+ specialized agents across 5 workflow phases
Manages sequential and parallel execution patterns
Stores phase deliverables in hierarchical memory structure
Provides pre-built scripts for workflow initialization
Includes comprehensive success metrics and KPIs
Supports adaptive optimization in post-launch phase
limitations: Requires 10-week timeline commitment for full workflow
Needs access to Claude Flow swarm coordination tools
Memory system required for cross-phase data persistence
Complexity may be overkill for simple product launches

use_cases.target_user: Product managers launching new SaaS products
use_cases.title: SaaS Product Launch Coordination
use_cases.description: Orchestrate development, marketing, and sales teams for a comprehensive SaaS launch with proper sequencing and dependencies.

use_cases.target_user: Startup founders with limited team resources
use_cases.title: Resource-Efficient Launch Management
use_cases.description: Leverage AI agents to fill expertise gaps across development, marketing, and sales functions for lean teams.

use_cases.title: Multi-Stakeholder Launch Alignment
use_cases.description: Coordinate complex launches across engineering, marketing, sales, support, and executive stakeholders with clear accountability.

prompt_templates.title: Initialize New Product Launch
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new product launch workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to launch a new product called [PRODUCT_NAME]. Please initialize the complete 10-week product launch workflow with all 15 agents coordinated across the 5 phases from research to post-launch optimization.

prompt_templates.title: Phase 2 Development Kickoff
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on the market research and product strategy from Phase 1, spawn the 6 development agents (backend, frontend, mobile, database, security, QA) to build the product in parallel over 6 weeks.

prompt_templates.title: Launch Day Execution
prompt_templates.prompt: We are ready to launch. Please execute Phase 4 with production validation, deployment, marketing blitz, and real-time monitoring setup for launch week.

prompt_templates.title: Post-Launch Optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate the weekly performance report for week [N] post-launch and identify optimization opportunities for conversion rates, support efficiency, and marketing ROI.

output_examples.input: Initialize product launch for TaskFlow AI
output: - Market Researcher: Analyzing $2B TAM, 50k potential customers
- Business Analyst: Creating SWOT analysis and 3-year projections
- Product Manager: Defining positioning and go-to-market strategy
‚öôÔ∏è Phase 2: Development (Weeks 3-8) - Ready to spawn 6 agents
üì¢ Phase 3: Marketing Prep (Weeks 5-9) - Campaigns and content
üöÄ Phase 4: Launch (Week 10) - Deployment and marketing blitz
üìä Phase 5: Optimization (Week 11+) - Weekly reviews and improvements

best_practices: Store all phase deliverables in memory using the hierarchical namespace pattern for cross-team visibility
Run security audits in Phase 2 before production deployment to avoid launch delays
Use parallel execution for development and marketing prep to compress timeline while maintaining quality
Set up monitoring dashboards before launch to track real-time metrics during launch week
anti_patterns: Skipping Phase 1 research and jumping straight to development without market validation
Running all phases sequentially instead of overlapping development with marketing preparation
Launching without proper monitoring setup, making it impossible to track launch success metrics

faq.question: Is this workflow compatible with agile development methodologies?
faq.answer: Yes, Phase 2 development uses parallel agile sprints with continuous integration and testing, while maintaining coordination with other phases.

faq.question: What are the minimum system requirements for running this workflow?
faq.answer: Requires Claude Flow with swarm coordination capabilities, memory system for data persistence, and ability to spawn 15+ agent types concurrently.

faq.question: Can I customize the timeline or skip certain phases?
faq.answer: The workflow is modular - you can adjust phase durations or skip phases, but the full 10-week timeline is optimized for comprehensive launches.

faq.question: How is sensitive business data protected during the launch process?
faq.answer: All data is stored in your local memory system with namespace isolation. No external APIs or data sharing occurs without explicit configuration.

faq.question: What happens if we encounter critical issues during launch?
faq.answer: Phase 4 includes rollback procedures and the production validator ensures go/no-go decisions are made before full launch activation.

faq.question: How does this compare to traditional project management tools?
faq.answer: Unlike static Gantt charts, this uses adaptive AI agents that can adjust execution based on real-time feedback and cross-phase dependencies.
